Recommended By Curators

Read the full review here .

About This Game

Plush combines stuffed animal simulation with the imagination of a little girl to provide a unique puzzle experience. To successfully complete each level, the player must arrange the stuffed animals in such a way as to make them all "happy" before bedtime. Each stuffed animal has it's own preferences (and physics), so this is easier said than done. Despite the relaxing atmosphere, make no mistake, 'Easy' difficulty is enjoyable for kids and casual gamers, 'Normal' and 'Hard' are a challenge that any puzzle gamer can appreciate.

Features

  • 40 puzzle levels and 3 difficulty options
  • Free play mode* (Play Room)
  • Steam Leaderboards† & Achievements
  • Colorblind mode
  • Unlockable Sound Board

  • There is no software defined limit to how many stuffed animals (and toy tanks) you can spawn in the Play Room. How many animals can be spawned before a drop in frame rates is notices will depend on your hardware and graphics settings.

†Leaderboards will not display in-game while the timer is hidden.
READ MORE

luckz
3,519 products in account
225 reviews
Not Recommended
1.8 hrs on record
Posted: June 24
I really don't always want to be the first guy to downvote popular games, but honestly, in this state the physics and especially the collision system make this game an experience with way more frustration potential than it should have.
If it were priced $10, the very gimmicky nature of this title would probably mandate a negative review anyway.
At the very friendly $4 price point seen here, the lacking depth and optimisation (try throwing 100-200 plushies into the air at decent gfx settings!) certainly are bear able, however to be classified moderately jolly, some improvements are needed.
That pillows are rigid bodies is a questionable design choice deeply ingrated into the design of many of the game levels, however it's very much immersion-breaking, and trying to shove a stuffed animal through a tight pillow funnel of unbendable durasteel is simply not fun. There's also the potential of them getting stuck inbetween pillows, as well as for animals to be on the floor in unreachable areas.
Victory conditions are glitchy (I've had levels end with tanks still on the bed, or with plushies moving in mid-air), and on hard mode, the fail condition comes with bugs like not resetting (but instead just suspending all animation) when an animal is on the night stand.
Plushies also have entirely different physics behaviour if you are controlling them versus if you are moving them by pushing them -- for example, a ginormous hippo is light like a feather if you just push it with something else, or a Scaredy Cat doesn't get nervous if it's pushed towards something that should set it off by another object. This might be by design for puzzle purposes, but like the pillow-rocks, it's not fun.

What is fun, however, are the nice voice-overs and the animal names (even if "MSP" should probably be a bit more colourful, like a pink/blue checkers pattern).


With a lot more polish, this could well turn into a positive review (extra bonus points for fluffy pillows!).
Read More

Alex3
200 products in account
23 reviews
Recommended
0.2 hrs on record
Posted: February 21
This game really helped me plan the seating arrangements for my wedding. My overly sensitive friend can't sit next to my vulgar drunk friend, and my friend who doesn't know anybody has to sit by my friend who's outgoing but not overbearing. My cousins can't sit next to my future husband's cousins because of mild racism, and his uncle will hit on his mom's friend. Thanks for Plush planning all of this was a breeze! Rarely does a game prepare you for real world problems like this does.

Most creative puzzle mechanics I've seen in years; and a truly soothing overall experience.

lamaslany
441 products in account
10 reviews
Recommended
1.1 hrs on record
Posted: February 13
I will be honest - my first impressions of this game are quite positive. I am indeed enjoying arranging stuffed toys on a bed.

The controls are smooth and uncomplicated. The graphics are ample to their need and the music is inoffensive enough to not be grating (and I do mean that in a nice way!).

I can see me having a fair amount of fun with this one.
